properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 3:46AM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Sioux Falls SD
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind
chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory,
mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to
two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting
as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard
conditions possible. Total additional snow accumulations of up
to one inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Beadle and Sanborn Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM Friday to
midnight CST Friday night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until
9 AM CST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late
Friday night through Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite
on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. Plan on slippery
road conditions with the morning and evening commutes of Friday
impacted.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the
latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST FRIDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
